Four Attributes of Empathy

 

To be able to see the world as others see it.

This requires putting your own "stuff" aside to see the situation through the other person's eyes.

 

To be nonjudgmental.

Judgement of another person's situation discounts the experience and is an attempt to protect ourselves from the pain of the situation.

 

To understand another person’s feelings.

We have to be in touch with our own feelings in order to understand someone else's. Again, this requires putting your own "stuff" aside to focus on the other person.

 

To communicate your understanding of that person’s feelings.

Rather than saying, "At least you..." or "It could be worse..." try, "I've been there, and that really hurts," or "It sounds like you are in a hard place now. Tell me more about it.”
